Despite successful lazy loading implementation, individual component render times are the primary cause of slow performance. **Goal**: Identify and eliminate performance bottlenecks in FileListItem and its sub-components to achieve sub-10ms render times per item. ## Current Situation Analysis ### Performance Data Discovered - **Lazy Loading**: Working correctly (loads 10 items initially, 36 placeholders) - **Data Loading**: Fast (Firestore queries complete quickly) - **Bottleneck**: Individual FileListItem render times of 50-800ms per component - **Impact**: 10 items taking ~1+ seconds to render due to component complexity ### Component Architecture ``` FileListItem.vue (Main container - 211 lines) â”œâ”€â”€ FileListItemContent.vue (File info display) â”œâ”€â”€ FileListItemTags.vue (Tag management) â””â”€â”€ FileListItemActions.vue (Action buttons) ``` ## Step 1: Granular Performance Profiling ### 1.1 Add Sub-Component Timing **Objective**: Identify which sub-component(s) are causing the slowdown **Files to Modify**: - `src/features/organizer/components/FileListItemContent.vue` - `src/features/organizer/components/FileListItemTags.vue` - `src/features/organizer/components/FileListItemActions.vue` **Implementation**: ```javascript // Add to each sub-component const renderStart = performance.now(); onMounted(() => { const renderTime = performance.now() - renderStart; if (renderTime > 5) { // Log renders taking >5ms debugLog(`ğŸŒ ${componentName} render: ${renderTime.toFixed(2)}ms for ${props.evidence?.name || props.evidence?.id}`); } }); ``` ### 1.2 Measure Component Lifecycle Phases **Objective**: Identify if slowdown is in setup, render, or mount phases **Implementation**: - Track `beforeMount`, `mounted`, and render times - Measure prop processing time - Monitor computed property calculation time - Track template rendering vs JavaScript execution ### 1.3 Vuetify Component Analysis **Objective**: Determine if Vuetify components are contributing to slowdown **Investigation Areas**: - `v-card` rendering performance - `v-chip` rendering for tags - `v-btn` and `v-icon` performance - Complex Vuetify layouts and grids ## Step 2: Component-Level Optimization ### 2.1 Computed Property Optimization **Objective**: Ensure computed properties are properly cached and efficient **Investigation**: - Review all computed properties in sub-components - Check for expensive calculations in templates - Verify proper dependency tracking - Eliminate redundant computations ### 2.2 Template Optimization **Objective**: Reduce template complexity and rendering overhead **Strategies**: - Minimize v-if/v-show conditional rendering - Reduce nested component depth - Optimize loop rendering in tags - Remove unnecessary watchers ### 2.3 Prop Processing Optimization **Objective**: Streamline prop validation and processing **Investigation**: - Review prop definitions and validation - Check for expensive prop transformations - Minimize prop drilling between components - Optimize evidence object access patterns ## Step 3: Selective Lazy Loading Implementation ### 3.1 Sub-Component Lazy Loading **Objective**: Implement progressive loading for heavy sub-components **Strategy**: - Load FileListItemContent immediately (essential info) - Lazy load FileListItemTags (secondary info) - Lazy load FileListItemActions (user interaction) **Implementation**: ```vue ``` ### 3.2 Progressive Enhancement **Objective**: Load minimal essential content first, enhance progressively **Phases**: 1. **Phase 1**: Basic file info only (name, size, date) 2. **Phase 2**: Tags and metadata 3. **Phase 3**: Full actions and interactions ## Step 4: Memory and Bundle Optimization ### 4.1 Component Import Analysis **Objective**: Identify heavy imports causing bundle bloat **Investigation**: - Analyze component bundle sizes - Check for unnecessary library imports - Review Vuetify component imports - Identify potential code splitting opportunities ### 4.2 Event Handler Optimization **Objective**: Minimize event handler overhead **Strategies**: - Use event delegation where possible - Minimize event listener creation - Optimize emit patterns - Reduce unnecessary re-renders from events ## Step 5: Performance Testing and Validation ### 5.1 Benchmark Testing **Objective**: Establish performance baselines and measure improvements **Metrics to Track**: - Individual component render times (target: <10ms) - Total list rendering time (target: <200ms for 10 items) - Memory usage during rendering - DOM manipulation overhead ### 5.2 Regression Testing **Objective**: Ensure optimizations don't break functionality **Test Areas**: - Tag management functionality - File action operations - Evidence display accuracy - Component interaction patterns ### 5.3 Real-World Performance Testing **Objective**: Test with realistic data loads **Test Scenarios**: - Small document sets (10-20 files) - Medium document sets (50-100 files) - Large document sets (200+ files) - Various file types and tag combinations ## Step 6: Advanced Optimization Techniques ### 6.1 Virtual Scrolling Consideration **Objective**: Evaluate if virtual scrolling would provide additional benefits **Analysis**: - Determine if DOM node count is contributing to slowdown - Evaluate virtual scrolling libraries compatibility with current design - Cost-benefit analysis of implementation complexity ### 6.2 Component Caching Strategy **Objective**: Cache rendered components to avoid re-rendering **Strategies**: - Implement component-level memoization - Cache expensive computed results - Use keep-alive for frequently accessed items - Optimize re-render triggers ## Expected Outcomes ### Performance Targets - **Individual FileListItem**: <10ms render time - **10-item list**: <100ms total render time - **50-item list**: <300ms total render time - **Memory usage**: Minimal growth with larger lists ### User Experience Improvements - Instant initial page load - Smooth scrolling performance - Responsive tag and action interactions - Consistent performance across document sizes ## Implementation Priority ### High Priority (Immediate Impact) 1. Sub-component performance profiling 2. Template optimization 3. Computed property optimization ### Medium Priority (Significant Gains) 1. Selective lazy loading 2. Import optimization 3. Event handler optimization ### Low Priority (Incremental Gains) 1. Virtual scrolling evaluation 2. Advanced caching strategies 3. Bundle splitting optimization ## Rollback Plan ### If Performance Degrades 1. Revert to current implementation 2. Keep lazy loading infrastructure 3. Apply optimizations incrementally 4. Use feature flags for testing ### If Functionality Breaks 1. Comprehensive component testing 2. Gradual rollout with monitoring 3. Fallback to previous stable version 4. Detailed regression testing ## Success Metrics ### Quantitative Metrics - Component render time: <10ms per FileListItem - Page load performance: <200ms for initial 10 items - Memory usage: <20% increase from baseline - Scroll performance: 60fps maintenance ### Qualitative Metrics - User perceived performance improvement - Smooth interaction experience - Maintained functionality across all features - Developer experience preservation ## Next Steps 1. **Immediate**: Add granular performance profiling to sub-components 2. **Week 1**: Complete performance analysis and identify bottlenecks 3. **Week 2**: Implement high-priority optimizations 4. **Week 3**: Test and validate performance improvements 5. **Week 4**: Deploy and monitor real-world performance ## Notes - Maintain backward compatibility throughout optimization - Document all performance changes for future reference - Consider creating performance regression tests - Keep user experience consistent during optimization - Monitor bundle size impact of any new dependencies ## Related Files ### Primary Files - `src/features/organizer/components/FileListItem.vue` - `src/features/organizer/components/FileListItemContent.vue` - `src/features/organizer/components/FileListItemTags.vue` - `src/features/organizer/components/FileListItemActions.vue` ### Supporting Files - `src/features/organizer/components/FileListDisplay.vue` (lazy loading implementation) - `src/composables/useLazyDocuments.js` (lazy loading logic) - Performance testing utilities and debug helpers --- **Total Estimated Time**: 2-3 weeks **Risk Level**: Medium (performance optimization without functionality loss) **Dependencies**: None (self-contained optimization)
